# Leo Raderman — Category Creator

> Serial entrepreneur who has founded five companies that entered their categories before the categories existed. Six-time founder with $100M+ exits and $65M+ in venture capital raised. Strategic advisor to founders via Pretty Well Fit.

## About

Leo Raderman is a serial entrepreneur, category creator, and strategic advisor based in Northern California. Over a 25-year career, he has founded or co-founded six companies across digital media, experiential technology, mobile, toys, and global healthcare — each time entering a market category before it existed.

He holds an M.A. in Systematic Theology from the Graduate Theological Union, Berkeley, and currently advises founders through Pretty Well Fit, his strategic advisory practice.

## Companies Founded

- [IFILM (1998–2005)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): First major user-generated video platform on the internet — six years before YouTube. Pioneered online video distribution and advertising-supported free streaming. Viacom acquired IFILM.com for $49M. Total IFILM enterprise asset sales exceeded $100M.
- [Obscura (2000–2017)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Co-founded architectural projection mapping. Pioneered immersive projections onto the Empire State Building, the Vatican, the Sydney Opera House — alighting imagination on landmarks worldwide. Company later acquired by Madison Square Garden Company. Core technology inspired and now powers The Sphere in Las Vegas.
- [Veeker (2006–2008)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Enabled mobile video and photo sharing pre-iPhone, pre-Instagram. First to deliver user-generated video clips to NBC News.
- [Nukotoys (2008–2013)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Created collectible trading cards that activated in-game characters with a tap on the screen — bridging physical toys and digital play. Licensed with Animal Planet and Ology Books. 2,500+ retail doors including Apple, Walmart, Target, Toys-R-Us, Barnes & Noble. VentureBeat Best Mobile App 2012.
- [MiracleFeet (2010–Present)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Brought low-cost clubfoot treatment to the developing world. Co-developed a transformative medical device with Stanford d.school. $500 transforms a life. 130,000+ children treated across 37 countries.

## Additional Experience

- Saatchi & Saatchi Darwin Digital (1997–1999): Managing Director & Creative Director. Employee #3.
- Pretty Well Fit (2023–Present): Managing Partner. Strategic advisory for founders building what comes next.

## Key Numbers

- 5 companies founded
- $100M+ largest exit (IFILM to Viacom)
- $65M+ capital raised
- 2,500+ retail doors (Nukotoys)
- 130,000+ children treated across 37 countries (MiracleFeet)

## Capital Formation

$65M+ raised across multiple rounds. The full capital formation lifecycle — friends and family through VC, strategic/corporate investors, term sheet negotiation, and exit. Presented to the full partnership at Kleiner Perkins. Pitched Sequoia, Benchmark, Andreessen Horowitz, Accel, NEA, DFJ, Bessemer, and nearly every major fund on Sand Hill Road. Closed John Malone's Liberty Digital, Roy Disney's Steamboat Ventures, Axiom Venture Partners, and Meritage Funds. Strategic investments from Sony, Yahoo!, Eastman Kodak, Independent Film Channel, Rainbow Media.

## Areas of Expertise

- Fundraising & Capital Formation
- Product Development & Go-to-Market
- New Category Creation & Market Education
- Marketing, Sales & Strategic Partnerships
- Legal, Operations & Company Building
- Retail Distribution at Scale

## Honors & Recognition

- Hollywood Reporter 35 Under 35
- GQ Man of the Month
- Red Herring / Newton Award
- IFILM Day — City of Los Angeles

## Press Coverage

Featured in New York Times, Variety, Bloomberg, TechCrunch, Wired, CNET, LA Times, Ad Age, GamesBeat, Communication Arts, Wall Street Journal, Hollywood Reporter, PBS, Fox News, GQ, The ToyBook, InformationWeek, Crain's New York.
